name: Quantizer
description: A multi-channel CV quantizer based on the disting EX Quad Quantizer. Quantizes CV inputs to specific scales and outputs CV and/or MIDI. Supports microtuning.

specifications.name: Channels
specifications.description: The number of independent quantizer channels.

parameters.name: Quantize mode
parameters.description: Sets the quantization mode (Nearest/Mapped/Warped).

parameters.name: Input transpose
parameters.description: Input transposition in 12-TET semitones.

parameters.name: Shift
parameters.description: In-scale shift amount.

parameters.name: Key
parameters.description: Sets the key (root note) of the scale.

parameters.name: Mode
parameters.description: Sets the scale mode (rotation). Displays familiar names for major scale.

parameters.name: Scale
parameters.description: The scale to quantize into (Chromatic, Major, Minor, etc., plus MIDI input options).

parameters.name: Output transpose
parameters.description: Output transposition in 12-TET semitones.

parameters.name: Output gate mode
parameters.description: Behavior of gate/trigger outputs (and MIDI notes).

parameters.name: Gate offset
parameters.description: Delays gate inputs relative to pitch inputs.

parameters.name: MIDI channel (in)
parameters.description: MIDI channel to receive notes on (for MIDI scale modes).

parameters.name: CV input
parameters.description: Pitch CV input bus for the channel (0=None).

parameters.name: Gate input
parameters.description: Optional gate input bus for the channel (0=None). Samples CV on high gate.

parameters.name: CV output
parameters.description: Pitch CV output bus for the channel (0=None). Always uses 'Replace' mode.

parameters.name: Gate output
parameters.description: Gate output bus for the channel (0=None). Behavior set by 'Output gate mode'. Always 'Replace' mode.

parameters.name: Change output
parameters.description: 'Change trigger' output bus. Fires when quantized note changes (0=None). Always 'Replace' mode.

parameters.name: MIDI channel (out)
parameters.description: MIDI channel to output notes on for this channel (0=Off).

parameters.name: Output to breakout
parameters.description: Enable MIDI output to the breakout port.

parameters.name: Output to Select Bus
parameters.description: Enable MIDI output to the Select Bus.

parameters.name: Output to USB
parameters.description: Enable MIDI output to USB.

parameters.name: Output to internal
parameters.description: Enable internal MIDI output (to other algorithms).

parameters.name: -48 48 0 ST Sets the input transposition, in 12-TET semitones. Shift
parameters.description: Sets the in-scale shift.

parameters.name: See above. Mode
parameters.description: Sets the mode, that is, the rotation of the notes within

parameters.name: 0 2 0 Sets the behaviour of the gate/trigger outputs. The options are: ‘Triggers', 'Inv Triggers' (inverted triggers, always high except for a low pulse when the trigger is fired, useful for driving an envelope generator which is generally in sustain but which needs to be retriggered when the chord changes), and 'Gates' (in which case the output is gated by the corresponding gate input). Note that this also applies to any MIDI output. Gate offset
parameters.description: Offsets (delays) the gate inputs relative to the pitch

input_ports.name: CV Input
input_ports.description: Pitch CV input for a channel.

input_ports.name: Gate Input
input_ports.description: Optional gate input for a channel.

output_ports.description: Quantized pitch CV output for a channel.
